texts.value: May confer resistance to the antitumor agent cisplatin. Binds to DNA and RNA

Isoform 3 and isoform 10 are predominantly nuclear and nucleolar. After treatment with proteasomal inhibitors and mild heat-shock stress, isoform 1, isoform 3, isoform 5, isoform 7, isoform 8 and isoform 10 are relocalized to the nucleolus as dot-like or irregular subnuclear structures. Isoform 1 colocalized with nuclear promyelocytic leukemia (PML) and Cajal bodies (CB); this association with nuclear bodies is enhanced in response to proteotoxic stress. Isoform 3, but not isoform 1 and isoform 5, is relocalized in nucleolar caps during transcriptional arrest

Isoform 1 is predominantly cytoplasmic. Isoform 1 colocalized with nuclear promyelocytic leukemia (PML) and Cajal bodies (CB); this association with nuclear bodies is enhanced in response to proteotoxic stress
Heat-shock stress up-regulated mRNA expression of isoform 10 and isoform 11. Heat-shock stress down-regulated short N-terminal mRNA expression of isoform 2, isoform 4, isoform 6 and isoform 9
C-terminal half (amino acids 134-284) contains cytoplasmic retention domains as well as determinants involved in its stress-induced nucleolar accumulation
Produced by alternative splicing of isoform 1
Produced by alternative splicing of isoform 2
Produced by alternative splicing of isoform 1
Produced by alternative splicing of isoform 2
Produced by alternative splicing of isoform 1
Produced by alternative splicing of isoform 1
Produced by alternative splicing of isoform 2
Produced by alternative splicing of isoform 1. In cells exposed to a mild heat schock
Produced by alternative splicing of isoform 2. In cells exposed to a mild heat schock

features.description: Necessary for nuclear localization and for nucleolar accumulation in response to heat shock
Necessary for nuclear and nucleolar localization
in isoform 2, isoform 4, isoform 6, isoform 9 and isoform 11
in isoform 3, isoform 4, isoform 7, isoform 8 and isoform 9
Reduces its nuclear and nucleolar accumulation. Increases its cytoplasmic accumulation.
Does not affect its subcellular distribution.
